grading_system.description: Grading system not definitively verified from official sources. California Retail Food Code compliance required but specific grading methodology not found.

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Madera County Fire Division / Madera County Fire Department
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems required per California Fire Code and NFPA standards - semi-annual inspections typically required
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual for fire suppression systems (per NFPA 96 standards)

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - Madera County Environmental Health conducts inspections
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Madera County Ordinance referenced in addition to CalCode

confidence_notes: While official Madera County Environmental Health website confirmed California Retail Food Code compliance and permit requirements, no specific grading system (letter grades, numerical scores, pass/fail) was found documented. Fire safety requirements confirmed but specific inspection procedures not detailed.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Madera County Environmental Health Division needed to verify: 1) Specific grading/scoring system used (A/B/C, numerical, pass/fail, or other), 2) Inspection frequency and risk-based scheduling, 3) Public disclosure requirements, 4) Specific fire department inspection procedures for commercial kitchen equipment
